result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery P Dishman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Distribute Recording of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid within the first 9 months of Probation. To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Probation is not to interfere with internet at work but Probation can monitor internet at his home. 
After 18 months, Probation may be terminated if Defendant successfully completes probation.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery P Dishman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision Early 
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Probation is terminated as of 05-20-2016 - signed and approved by Judge Aprahamian on 05-09-2016.
Email correspondence between Court and parties.  Approved by Judge Aprahamian on 5/9/16 to attempt to schedule trial in September 2016.
Signed by Judge Aprahamian on 5/9/16.
From DOC dated 5/2/16 re completion of probation.  Proposed amendment to JOC attached.
4 reference letters filed by defense
Letters from Resource Counseling

Defendant Jeffery P Dishman in court with attorney Craig M. Kuhary.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1.  Court orders the Report filed by Atty. Kuhary to be sealed. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  Sentence withheld for 3 years  Probation
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid in the 1st 9 months as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid in the 1st 9 months as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Probation is not to interfer with internet at work but probation can monitor internet at his home. After 18 months, Probation maybe terminated if defendant successfully completes probation.  
- 30 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
